thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Don’t Worry About American Consumers

author: Justin Lahart
title: Don’t Worry About American Consumers
text:
Consumer spending has gotten off to a rocky start this year. Don’t expect that to continue.
Retail sales weakened for the third month in a row in February, slipping even as the job market’s strength and tax cuts seem like they should have prompted people to buy more. Overall retail sales slipped by 0.1%, the Commerce Department reported Wednesday, versus the gain of 0.3% economists expected. Excluding automobile purchases, sales increased by 0.2%. Economists expected a 0.4% gain.
